revised_title: Morphological Analysis of Human Strains of Trypanosome in Nyasaland
tldr: The authors conducted a study on the morphology of various strains of the trypanosome causing disease in humans in Nyasaland. They analyzed ten strains and found that the passage through different animals did not significantly affect the characteristics of the trypanosome. The study concluded that a single species of trypanosome was being dealt with in the dimorphic trypanosome causing disease in man in Nyasaland.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Microbiology and Parasitology
